cloud today for the next 40 minutes I'll be taking you through how to get started with real-time streaming data on AWS
this session will give you better understanding of real-time streaming data use cases and also launching an
end-to-end real-time streaming application in AWS with just under five minutes
we have AWS experts on hand to answer any questions you may have during the presentation feel free to post your
question at any time in the Q&A console of this platform so the first question
you may be asking is yourself is really five minutes well the presentation is
over 30 minutes long while I describe some of the concepts to you but in reality yes we have shipped a number of

data you can use this solution straight away as well as customize the solution
to meet your needs we'll start the presentation with an overview of real-time streaming concepts
and related AWS services then you'll get to see a demo of real-time into an
analytic solution which will be spun up with CloudFormation template a service
used to orchestrate AWS resources and get an end-to-end application with
working dashboard is just under five minutes at the conclusion of this session I will point you to the most
relevant resources including tutorials and QuickStart guides associated with today's topic with that let's start with
an overview so what is streaming data when I like to think about streaming
data I like to think less about the actual type of the data and more about what you do with the data because to me
what you do with the data makes it streaming so for example for all world
streaming or Bosch methodology in order to get logs into a centralized reporting system you might be storing those logs
locally on a virtual machine or perhaps on-premises and saving them on disk then
you might have some process that wakes up once every minute or once every hour that sends those log to some centralized
storage solution after that there will be another process that wakes up or runs
every hour do batch ETL that takes it from centrally stored data performs a
lot of transformation and then loads it into a data warehouse for reporting purposes
streaming is a lot different than that and the key thing that you should think
about when you think about streaming data is continuous so instead of waking up a process to send those logs to a
central system some periodic interval and waiting for hours and days you'll be doing it continuously you'll be
continuously ingesting data as it is generated in real-time or near real-time so sub second or sub minute think of
that in your frame of your mind you'll be processing that data continuously on-the-fly and performing
real-time analytics machine learning and taking action continuously real-time so
why would you want to do this one of the main reason you're going to do this is that you want to capture value out of
your data more quickly the way I like to think about this it is that a business
report that's generated today is much more relevant than was generated last year taking to a more real time scenario
being able to identify customer issues or problems immediately is much more
valuable to find out after the fact think about your customer and visitor to retail physical store or website and
then left because they couldn't find what they were looking for or your IOT sensor indicated an issue that caused
the machine to go down and you found that out reactively instead of proactively so streaming data is really
about making timely decisions sync data
has a lot of common use cases from streaming video-streaming clickstream data streaming logs to have the most common
that I will highlight now first is click streaming data when I see click streaming data I mean capturing
user behavior through clicks either on web or mobile clients so that it could
be ingesting player behavior on your mobile game it could be ingesting behavior about potential customers on
your website so ingesting clickstream data at very fine granularity into AWS
cloud is a very common use case using a set of aw streaming services the reason
why that use case is very popular is because when you have thousands of users or tens of thousands of users or
millions of users you are trying to find out at a granular level what those users
are doing to make optimization on your website that's the streaming data problem another common and very similar use case
is log data capturing logs from virtual machines what's going on on the business
application even consider IOT sensors telemetry and machine generated data are
all streaming data problem and if you want to capture and process it in near real-time streaming data is the right
tool for you Amazon Kinesis is a set of
streaming data services on AWS there are four services to cover the entire
streaming data lifecycle end to end we ship Kinesis video streams at reinvent
2017 which allows you to capture process and store video data in real time but
today is session the focus is going to be on the three data services that we have the first service is Kinesis data
stream which we shipped five years ago is a core foundational service that
allows you to capture process and store data streams durably you can think it
off as a pipe where you continuously stream data into a data stream when the
data is durable is stored anywhere between 24 hours to 7 days and then you
have a set of application that continuously read from the stream so you can think it as a temporary pipe that
you can write with the hive wall and read with a very high volume in real-time Kinesis data firehose the
second service we launched allows you to deliver streaming data from point A to point B without you writing any code so
it takes one of the most common streaming use cases streaming ETL or extract transform and load and makes it
super simple the way it works is you set up a data producer to ingest data to Kinesis data firehose with a set of
configuration and then the data is passed and delivered to Amazon s3 Amazon
redshift or data warehousing service and was an elastic search for real-time or
near real-time log analytics and log search and also Splunk Kinesis data
analytics allows you to write secure code over the data flowing through Kinesis data streams and can use the
data firehose you can imagine you have a sequel query that generates a continuous
metric rather than ad hoc every 5 minute or as fine-grain as every second the
metric might be the number of visitors on your website or it might be an average temperature of IOT sensor or
telemetry data this is great for doing things like real-time leaders boards or dashboards like business and operational
dashboards amazon Kinesis is a
foundational service that is widely used across amazon and it is used for a lot of similar use cases that I brought up
previously for example AWS metering the record that makes up your AWS bill uses kinases data
stream as a mechanism to ingest data as their first step to centralized it offers the very fine-grain and high
scale required for the first step of aggregation of your bill cloud watch logs is also built on kinases as a
transport layer and mechanism to capture high volume of data stream so it is used
both externally and internally at Amazon as a mechanism to capture high volume of
data streams these three services that I
described can work together in a lot of different ways and they work with a lot of other aw
you may have your data producer writing data to Kinesis data stream Kinesis data
analytics is performing an aggregation filter or maybe doing some enrichment and then using Kinesis data Pharos to
deliver the data to your data warehouse maybe amazon has redshift this flow is
very very common pattern when you are using Canisius data stream as a flexible way to get data into AWS cloud we just
talked about the Kinesis data family consumers but there are a lot of different consumers you can attach to
Kinesis data streams some of them are listed on this slide the - I will call out one of the most popular way is to
run custom code on ec2 is using open source library that we provided called
Kinesis client library that solves a lot of undifferentiated heavy lifting for you like fault tolerance load balancing
that type of thing it allows you to process data flowing from Kinesis stream at scale another option is AWS lambda
which works great for discrete even processing performing filtering there's
a lot of different options for you to process data of Kinesis data streams these are a couple of them all of these
services are fully managed scalable and secure the last point that I really want
to bring up is cost-effectiveness when you are ingesting data real time at scale sitting a biscuit base box
solution can become quite expensive Amazon Kinesis Data Family Services lets
you cost typically do that Kinesis data
streams it provides a lot of flexibility with getting data into stream as well as getting data out of the stream there are
a number of data producers that can write to Canisius data streams everything from AWS SDK number of
logging agents fluent a flume and many others the key to Amazon Canisius data
stream and steering in general is that sort of one-to-many consumer model so
it's not just you could have single consumer reading of the stream you can have many consumers reading of the
stream that served different cases maybe the analytic app is producing a business report in real time
maybe your lambda functions triggering a business flow based of a particular event that's doing filtering and then
starting off a process to change some underlying infrastructure the key thing about Kinesis data stream is flexibility
Kinesis data firehose I mentioned that this service is meant for delivery of point A to point B at high scale without
you having to write any code with Kinesis firehose you don't need to configure a consumer or you don't have
to write any code to date it from this shape you set up a producer as well as a set of configuration of where and how
you want the data to be delivered we have a number of ways to ingest a 10-2 Canisius firehose it has a write API you
can use AWS SDK agents to write data into Kinesis data firehose there are
also many automatic ways to in this data into Kinesis data firehose cloud watch logs have a feature called
long subscription where you can essentially check a box and the data is delivered to Kinesis data firehose with
AWS iot you can set up AM qtt broker and iot rules to send the data to firehose
there are a lot of ways to deliver data into Kinesis firehose delivery stream with the transformation we do in Kinesis
firehose we also have a lot of configuration option that you can set up frequency and size of delivery will also
do optionally encryption and compression lambda integration provides the required
flexibility for Canisius data firehose to do simple transformation to records like converting to custom format to json
record enrichment and also heavier transformation like per K or C delivery
these are column that data format and with this you will see significant improvement and in its query times and
reduction to cost from downstream application the final step is delivery
so you can use a data firehose that supports delivering up to four different services Amazon s3 and was in redshift
and was in elasticsearch and also Splunk you can choose one of this destination and after it's set up will continuously
deliver data to those destination so imagine an end-to-end solution would be you're running the AWS mobile sdk which
is continuously writing data to Amazon Canisius data firehose you're performing some forward translation and compression
and delivering it to s3 every minute once that pipeline is set up it's virtually no operation for you and
there's no app for you to manage we do it fully managed Connexus data analytics
is the third service the way the service works is you can write sequel query on data flowing through Kinesis data
streams and Cleese's data firehose and the typical use cases are one continuous
metric generation - responsive analytics the way they differ is with the primary
action you take after you compute the metric for the continuous metric generation the action is usually to send
it to another service for storage and later analysis so in the business metric generation you'll typically send this to
a data warehouse or a database Kinesis data analytics have capabilities to aggregate filter and enrich the
streaming data the value of using Kinesis data analytics is that instead of sending those services tens of
thousands or millions of data points you are sending them a thousand useful pieces of information you're skipping a
bunch of ETL steps and the data is delivered to a table that's immediately
available to query by application and also users is under in under minutes and
under five minutes with sort of a single application versus a more robust harder
to manage ETL pipeline the second use case is responsive analytics so instead
of using primary action to store the data the primary action is to react to the data as an example might be to send
notification programmatically to change the behavior of the machine based of a predefined matrix we covered some
internal customers that uses Kinesis what about some external customers and the streaming data is used pretty much
across industry verticals and in a wide variety of settings a couple of good examples here Zynga uses
data analytics and Amazon Kinesis for real-time game events analytics so on
their web and mobile games people comes in and they're doing user behavior analytics finding out what games are
popular that type of thing using tenacious data analytics another great example is Hearst Corporation house
corporation ingests clickstream data from their website in order to deliver more effective content to the users
Hearst owns a large number of online and print publication like newspapers when a
particle gets a particular article becomes popular they promote that across all of their publications that give them
popular content to more and more users so this is an example of responsive analytics versus the primary action
being just ingest and store Netflix is using Kinesis data streams to ingest VPC
flow log data they're doing this to detect interesting things that are going on on their network and they're VPC so
what they have set up in their VPC is they generate the log data associated
